I will be watching this again.  I believe this is told from a "Christian" perspective, rather than a Roman Catholic one, but it doesn’t detract to my mind.

Somehow, this movie managed to surpass my expectations. It is well-crafted, thoughtful and heartfelt without conventional elements in mainstream films. It's cheesy, it's simple, it's clichéd, that's why I like it.

This movie does an amazing job of answering questions most people have asked at some point in their lifetime. It’s refreshing to see something honest and hopeful, instead of the mainstream despair that’s often fed to the public and has caused everyone to grow accustomed to it and overall desensitized.

I first listened to the digital audiobook and I LOVED the story. So, when the movie was released, I was overjoyed.  This movie really rose to the occasion. It is a beautiful film with stellar acting and cinematography.  It is a heartbreaking story but still an incredibly amazing film.

The Shack is a deeply moving movie that powerfully shows God's love and grace. It’s a great reminder of how much God cares for us and can really strengthen and inspire faith.

It was a beautiful movie. I loved all the scenery and cgi. If you really understand the characters emotions it is beautiful.

I really enjoyed this movie 10/10. I feel like if you’re on a journey walking with God or yearning for a deeper relationship with him , this movie might just push that along further.  I was crying a ridiculous amount and was really healing with this movie as well. I would definitely recommend this movie.

One of the most powerful aspects of The Shack is how it presents God’s love in an intimate, personal way. The portrayal of God as “Papa” is a beautiful reminder that our relationship with Him is not distant or cold, but deeply personal and nurturing. It’s heartbreaking to see some critics twist this into something shameful, showing just how unwilling they are to even try to understand the nature of God’s love. Those who mock this film are often the same people who reject faith altogether—of course, they won’t understand something they refuse to open their hearts to.

Father God, thank you. No matter what we endure here, on this side of heaven, You are beautiful and ever present. Thank you for coming to earth, for allowing me to have the choice to choose You! To chose me, period. Thank you for your Son, Jesus. For Your Holy Spirit of discernment inside me. I love you, Father God. In Jesus name... I love you! Amen
